verses.kjv: Woe to the crown of pride, to the drunkards of Ephraim, whose glorious beauty is a fading flower, which are on the head of the fat valleys of them that are overcome with wine!
verses.ct: Disaster is coming to the proud crown of Ephraim's drunkards, whose stunning beauty is like a wilting flower, sitting atop the rich valley of those staggering from wine!

verses.kjv: Behold, the Lord hath a mighty and strong one, which as a tempest of hail and a destroying storm, as a flood of mighty waters overflowing, shall cast down to the earth with the hand.
verses.ct: Look — the Lord has someone powerful and strong. Like a hailstorm, like a devastating tornado, like a rushing flood of water, he will hurl it to the ground with force.

verses.kjv: The crown of pride, the drunkards of Ephraim, shall be trodden under feet:
verses.ct: The proud crown of Ephraim's drunkards will be trampled underfoot.

verses.kjv: And the glorious beauty, which is on the head of the fat valley, shall be a fading flower, and as the hasty fruit before the summer; which when he that looketh upon it seeth, while it is yet in his hand he eateth it up.
verses.ct: That stunning beauty sitting atop the rich valley will be like a wilting flower, like an early fig before harvest — as soon as someone spots it, they grab it and swallow it down.

verses.kjv: In that day shall the LORD of hosts be for a crown of glory, and for a diadem of beauty, unto the residue of his people,
verses.ct: On that day, the LORD of Hosts will become a beautiful crown and a glorious headband for the remnant of his people.

verses.kjv: And for a spirit of judgment to him that sitteth in judgment, and for strength to them that turn the battle to the gate.
verses.ct: He will give a spirit of justice to the one who sits as judge, and he will give strength to those who push the battle back to the enemy's gates.

verses.kjv: But they also have erred through wine, and through strong drink are out of the way; the priest and the prophet have erred through strong drink, they are swallowed up of wine, they are out of the way through strong drink; they err in vision, they stumble in judgment.
verses.ct: But even these people stumble because of wine and stagger from alcohol. Priests and prophets reel from strong drink — they are consumed by wine, they stagger from alcohol. They see false visions and make terrible decisions.

verses.kjv: For all tables are full of vomit and filthiness, so that there is no place clean.
verses.ct: Every table is covered with vomit and filth, with not a clean spot anywhere.

verses.kjv: Whom shall he teach knowledge? and whom shall he make to understand doctrine? them that are weaned from the milk, and drawn from the breasts.
verses.ct: They mock, 'Who does he think he's teaching? Who is he trying to instruct? Babies just taken off the breast? Toddlers just weaned from milk?'

verses.kjv: For precept must be upon precept, precept upon precept; line upon line, line upon line; here a little, and there a little:
verses.ct: 'It's just rule after rule, rule after rule, line after line, line after line, a little bit here, a little bit there.'

verses.kjv: For with stammering lips and another tongue will he speak to this people.
verses.ct: Fine then — God will speak to this people through foreign lips and a strange language.

verses.kjv: To whom he said, This is the rest wherewith ye may cause the weary to rest; and this is the refreshing: yet they would not hear.
verses.ct: He had told them, 'This is the place of rest — let the exhausted find rest here. This is the place of renewal.' But they refused to listen.

verses.kjv: But the word of the LORD was unto them precept upon precept, precept upon precept; line upon line, line upon line; here a little, and there a little; that they might go, and fall backward, and be broken, and snared, and taken.
verses.ct: So the word of the LORD will become for them rule after rule, rule after rule, line after line, line after line, a little here, a little there — so that they will stumble backward, be broken, trapped, and captured.

verses.kjv: Wherefore hear the word of the LORD, ye scornful men, that rule this people which is in Jerusalem.
verses.ct: So listen to the word of the LORD, you arrogant men who rule this people in Jerusalem.

verses.kjv: Because ye have said, We have made a covenant with death, and with hell are we at agreement; when the overflowing scourge shall pass through, it shall not come unto us: for we have made lies our refuge, and under falsehood have we hid ourselves:
verses.ct: You boast, 'We've struck a deal with death, and we've made an agreement with the grave. When the overwhelming disaster sweeps through, it won't touch us, because we've made lies our shelter and hidden ourselves behind deception.'

verses.kjv: Therefore thus saith the Lord GOD, Behold, I lay in Zion for a foundation a stone, a tried stone, a precious corner stone, a sure foundation: he that believeth shall not make haste.
verses.ct: Therefore the Lord GOD says this: 'Look — I am placing a foundation stone in Zion, a tested stone, a precious cornerstone, a solid foundation. Whoever trusts in it will never panic.'

verses.kjv: Judgment also will I lay to the line, and righteousness to the plummet: and the hail shall sweep away the refuge of lies, and the waters shall overflow the hiding place.
verses.ct: 'I will make justice the measuring line and righteousness the standard. Hail will destroy your shelter of lies, and floodwaters will sweep away your hiding place.'

verses.kjv: And your covenant with death shall be disannulled, and your agreement with hell shall not stand; when the overflowing scourge shall pass through, then ye shall be trodden down by it.
verses.ct: Your deal with death will be canceled, and your agreement with the grave will collapse. When the overwhelming disaster sweeps through, you will be crushed by it.

verses.kjv: From the time that it goeth forth it shall take you: for morning by morning shall it pass over, by day and by night: and it shall be a vexation only to understand the report.
verses.ct: Every time it comes, it will seize you — morning after morning it will pass through, day and night. Understanding this message will bring nothing but sheer terror.

verses.kjv: For the bed is shorter than that a man can stretch himself on it: and the covering narrower than that he can wrap himself in it.
verses.ct: The bed is too short to stretch out on, and the blanket is too narrow to wrap around yourself.

verses.kjv: For the LORD shall rise up as in mount Perazim, he shall be wroth as in the valley of Gibeon, that he may do his work, his strange work; and bring to pass his act, his strange act.
verses.ct: The LORD will rise up as he did at Mount Perazim; he will be angry as he was in the valley of Gibeon — to carry out his work, his unexpected work, and accomplish his task, his strange task.

verses.kjv: Now therefore be ye not mockers, lest your bands be made strong: for I have heard from the Lord GOD of hosts a consumption, even determined upon the whole earth.
verses.ct: So stop your mocking now, or your chains will be tightened even more. I have heard directly from the Lord GOD of Hosts about a destruction that has been decreed against the entire land.

verses.kjv: Give ye ear, and hear my voice; hearken, and hear my speech.
verses.ct: Pay attention and listen to what I'm saying; listen carefully to my words.

verses.kjv: Doth the plowman plow all day to sow? doth he open and break the clods of his ground?
verses.ct: Does a farmer plow all day long just to plant? Does he keep breaking up and turning the soil forever?

verses.kjv: When he hath made plain the face thereof, doth he not cast abroad the fitches, and scatter the cummin, and cast in the principal wheat and the appointed barley and the rie in their place?
verses.ct: Once he has leveled the surface, doesn't he scatter dill and spread cumin? Doesn't he plant wheat in rows, barley in its designated place, and spelt along the edges?

verses.kjv: For his God doth instruct him to discretion, and doth teach him.
verses.ct: His God teaches him the right way to do it and instructs him.

verses.kjv: For the fitches are not threshed with a threshing instrument, neither is a cart wheel turned about upon the cummin; but the fitches are beaten out with a staff, and the cummin with a rod.
verses.ct: Dill isn't threshed with a heavy sledge, and a cart wheel isn't rolled over cumin. Instead, dill is beaten out with a stick, and cumin with a rod.

verses.kjv: Bread corn is bruised; because he will not ever be threshing it, nor break it with the wheel of his cart, nor bruise it with his horsemen.
verses.ct: Grain for bread must be ground, but no one threshes it endlessly. When he drives his cart wheel over it, his horses don't crush it to powder.

verses.kjv: This also cometh forth from the LORD of hosts, which is wonderful in counsel, and excellent in working.
verses.ct: This wisdom also comes from the LORD of Hosts, who is amazing in his plans and magnificent in his results.
